paper_metadata.title: Utility of Genetic Testing in Patients with Transthyretin Amyloid Cardiomyopathy: A Brief Review
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for the TTR gene, including penetrance data.

patients.phenotype: sensory-motor idiopathic polyneuropathy with red flags

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Consecutively, a family screening discovered thirty-three carriers (seven symptomatic and twenty-six presymptomatic).
Consecutively, a family screening discovered thirty-three carriers (seven symptomatic and twenty-six presymptomatic).

functional_data.summary: The p.Val50Met variant is associated with a higher prevalence in certain geographic areas.

variants.segregation_data: Yes, it segregates with disease in families.
variants.additional_notes: The penetrance of the disease is variable.
key_quotes: The penetrance of the disease is variable.
Some of the variants are more prevalent in certain geographic areas due to the founder effect, like the p.Val50Met variant.

individual_records.phenotype_details: diagnosed with ATTRv (with exclusive polyneuropathy involvement)
individual_records.evidence_sentence: One of the subjects was diagnosed with ATTRv (with exclusive polyneuropathy involvement) and started on tafamidis.
Six other asymptomatic carriers of the variant started the multidisciplinary follow-up.

functional_data.summary: The p.Val142Ile variant is more prevalent among African Americans.

variants.segregation_data: Yes, it segregates with disease in families.
variants.additional_notes: The variant is associated with late-onset cardiomyopathy.
key_quotes: The p.Val142Ile mutation remains more prevalent among African Americans.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text.
